topo.interpolation package

Submodules

topo.interpolation.interpolation module

topo.interpolation.interpolation.fill_missing_iterative(data, config)[source]

Iteratively fill np.nan cells by averaging over valid neighbors. Skips boundary cells marked as ‘B’.

Parameters:

  • data – 2D NumPy array (dtype=object). float cells = numeric data, np.nan = missing, ‘B’ = boundary

  • config (TopoConfig) – TopoConfig, which may include fill_max_iterations, fill_tolerance, etc.

Returns:

data (in-place)

topo.interpolation.interpolation.fill_missing(data, config)[source]

Dispatch to the appropriate fill method based on config.fill_method.
